title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thunder showers will occur at times in Uva and Southern provinces and in Ampara, Batticaloa, Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: Hamas set to release four Israeli soldier hostages in second swap
byline: The Palestinian militant movement Hamas is expected to release four female Israeli soldiers on Saturday in exchange for a group of Palestinian prisoners under a ceasefire agreement aimed at ending the 15-month-old war in Gaza.

title: 29-Year-old drug dealer arrested with narcotics and weapons in Mt. Lavinia
byline: The Special Operations Unit of the Police Special Task Force (STF) has arrested an individual who was in possession of various narcotics, along with other properties, in the Wimalasiri De Mel area of the Mt Lavinia police division, in connection with the crime and drug prevention operation.

title: Suspect arrested with over 100 kg of Kerala cannabis in Palali
byline: The officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) have arrested a suspect who was in possession of 101 kilograms and 833 grams of Kerala cannabis during a raid carried out at the Antani Puram beach in the Palali police division, in connection with crime and drug prevention operation.

title: Yoshitha Rajapaksa arrested
byline: Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (25), according to the Police Media Spokesman.

title: Anuja, a short film set in India, secures Oscar nomination
byline: Set in India, Anuja, a short film about two sisters struggling to find joy and opportunity in a world intent on their exploitation and exclusion, has secured a nomination for Best Live Action Short at the 97th Academy Awards.

title: Indira ceding Katchatheevu to Sri Lanka strategic move: Congress
byline: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC) president K Selvaperunthagai on Thursday criticised BJP president K Annamalai for his remarks against former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi for giving Katchatheevu to Sri Lanka.

title: Former President Sirisena urges action to prevent flood damage in Polonnaruwa
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena has called on the government to expedite the construction of canals to divert excess water from the Moragahakanda and Kalu Ganga reservoirs to Anuradhapura and the North Western Province, highlighting the urgent need to mitigate flood damage in the Polonnaruwa District.

title: PAC to recommend to TN govt. to facilitate return of refugees in Mandapam camp to Sri Lanka
byline: India’s Public Accounts Committee chairperson K. Selvaperunthagai said here on Thursday that the committee would recommend to the State government to facilitate the return of refugees who wish to go back to Sri Lanka.

title: Performance-based targets given for all Sri Lankan diplomats: Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Vocational Education Nalin Hewage says that new changes have been made to Sri Lanka’s diplomatic service, emphasizing the introduction of performance-based targets for ambassadors and high commissioners.

title: ‘Emilia Pérez’ tops Oscar nominations with 13
byline: In the wake of devastating wildfires in Los Angeles that struck at the heart of the movie industry, an embattled Hollywood lined up behind the Netflix narco-musical about trans identity “Emilia Pérez” in Oscar nominations Thursday.

title: Exams chief reveals highest marks achieved in 2024 Scholarship Exam
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations Amith Jayasundara says that the highest score achieved in the 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination across Sri Lanka is 188.

title: 31-year-old hacked to death in Echchankulam
byline: A 31-year-old youth was reportedly hacked to death with a sharp weapon in the Sundarapuram area of the Echchankulam police division.

title: South Sudan suspends social media platforms over videos of Sudan killings
byline: South Sudanese authorities have suspended access to social media platforms for a minimum of 30 days after videos depicting the alleged killings of South Sudanese nationals in Sudan’s El Gezira state triggered riots and deadly revenge attacks.

title: Thousands flock to see rare, smelly corpse flower bloom in Sydney
byline: A rare plant known as the corpse flower bloomed in Sydney on Friday for the first time in more than a decade, emitting an odour likened to rotting flesh and delighting thousands who queued for a whiff.

title: Ex-WPC member Salochana Gamage granted bail
byline: The two individuals including former member of Western Provincial Council Salochana Gamage, who were arrested while allegedly accepting a bribe, have been granted bail after being produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (24).

title: Shammi Silva set to be re-elected as SLC chief for third term?
byline: Incumbent Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) President Shammi Silva is set to be re-elected to the top post for his third successive two-year term during the Board’s Annual General Meeting (AGM) to be held on March 31, Indian media reported.

title: Four Sri Lankans in ICC ODI Team of the Year 2024
byline: Sri Lanka’s Charith Asalanka has been named the captain of the ICC Men’s ODI Team of the Year for 2024, with Kusal Mendis included as the wicketkeeper while Pathum Nissanka and Wanindu Hasaranga are also part of the team.

title: SLPP to launch LG election campaign tomorrow
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) is set to commence its campaigning activities for the upcoming Local Government (LG) elections tomorrow (25) in Anuradhapura.

title: Govt takes responsibility for containers cleared by customs without inspection
byline: The government will assume full responsibility for the 323 containers recently released from Sri Lanka Customs without inspection, according to Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation, Janith Ruwan Kodituwakku.

title: New chairman appointed to CoPA
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Hambantota District Parliamentarian Aravinda Senarath has been appointed as the new Chairman of the Committee on Public Accounts (CoPA).

title: Spa owner sentenced for forcing Indonesian women into prostitution
byline: The Colombo High Court today (24) sentenced an owner of a spa who was found guilty of employing three young Indonesian women in prostitution, after bringing them to Sri Lanka on the pretext of offering them jobs as therapists.

title: Ex-President Mahinda files petition seeking to reinstate his security detail
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has filed a fundamental rights (FR) petition with the Supreme Court seeking an order for the deployment of his security detail which had been reduced.

title: Sri Lanka revokes power purchase deal with Adani Group, AFP reports
byline: Sri Lanka has revoked a power purchase deal with India’s Adani Group after a probe into U.S. allegations that the conglomerate’s executives paid bribes to secure Indian power supply contracts, according to an AFP report published by the Economic Times newspaper on Friday.

title: Adani Group denies cancellation of Sri Lanka power purchase deal
byline: India’s Adani Group has denied the cancellation of its $440 million power purchase deal with Sri Lanka, terming the reports as “false and misleading”.

title: Swiss govt pledges support to reclaim Sri Lankan assets held abroad
byline: The Ambassador of Switzerland to Sri Lanka and Ambassador designate to the Maldives, Dr. Siri Walt, has assured Switzerland’s support in recovering assets that have been moved out of Sri Lanka.

title: Dilith Jayaweera says govt is covering up every issue with fiction
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’, Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera claims that the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) is currently facing a challenge from within its own people within a very short period of time.

title: Verticality key for Sri Lanka as apparel exports grow 5% in 2024
byline: When combined with direct exports of textiles, Sri Lanka’s overall export value surpassed the $5bn mark, with JAAF suggesting it showcases the country’s resilience in the face of both local and global adversities.

title: Awareness programme held on introducing e-NIC
byline: An awareness programme to introduce the process and discuss issues related to the Electronic National Identity Card (e-NIC) was held today (24) at the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka (ICTA), Colombo.

title: Investigations underway into cause of animal deaths at Beira Lake
byline: The National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency (NARA) says steps will be taken to provide the research report on water samples related to the death of several animals in the Beira Lake in Colombo, within three days.

title: Belarus election is poised to extend the 30-year rule of ‘Europe’s last dictator’
byline: The last time Belarus staged a presidential election in 2020, authoritarian leader Alexander Lukashenko was declared the winner with 80% of the vote.

title: Suspect arrested for possession of suspected excavated artifacts
byline: Giranegama Police have arrested a suspect for possession of items believed to be excavated artifacts.

title: Yoshitha arrested by CID in connection with land case involving Daisy Forrest
byline: Further details have emerged regarding the arrest of Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning (25).

title: Sri Lanka’s first female Ambassador to Qatar assumes duties
byline: The newly appointed Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to the State of Qatar, Roshan Sithara Khan Azard, assumed duties at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Doha recently becoming Sri Lanka’s first lady Ambassador to the State of Qatar.

title: US issues broad freeze on foreign aid after Trump orders review
byline: The U.S. State Department issued a “stop-work” order on Friday for all existing foreign assistance and paused new aid, according to a cable seen by Reuters, after President Donald Trump ordered a pause to review if aid allocation was aligned with his foreign policy.

title: Sri Lanka Air Force Commander set to retire
byline: The incumbent Commander of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF), Air Marshal Udeni Rajapaksha, is slated to retire on January 29.

title: SLFEB reports surge in cases of foreign employment scams
byline: The Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau (SLFEB) has reported a rise in incidents where individuals are paying money to illegal foreign employment agencies seeking overseas employment.

title: Yoshitha Rajapaksa brought to CID after arrest
byline: Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, was brought to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago, following his arrest this morning (25).

title: Sri Lanka Railways to launch additional services to boost tourism
byline: Sri Lanka Railways announced plans to introduce new train services to enhance tourism in the country, starting from February 01.

title: President’s Fund to provide services at regional level from Feb. 7
byline: In an effort to provide more efficient services to the public, the President’s Fund is set to launch a new initiative to deliver services at the regional level through the offices of the Divisional Secretaries, under the leadership of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on February 7 at the Temple Trees, Colombo.

title: Court grants bail to suspect in ex-Minister Anura Yapa’s fraud case
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has granted bail to a suspect arrested in connection with the case involving former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa.

title: Sri Lanka has not cancelled agreement with Adani Group – Cabinet Spokesman
byline: Sri Lanka’s Cabinet Spokesman, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has clarified that the Cabinet of Ministers has not made a decision to cancel the agreement with India’s Adani Group regarding wind energy projects in the country.

title: SLFP to contest under ‘Hand’ symbol in upcoming elections?
byline: Political sources indicate that Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) organizers are firmly advocating for contesting the upcoming elections under the ‘hand’ symbol.

title: Yoshitha Rajapaksa produced before court
byline: Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning, has been produced before the Colombo Additional Magistrate, a short while ago.

title: Yoshitha Rajapaksa remanded
byline: Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, has been remanded until January 27, after being produced before the Colombo Additional Magistrate today (25).
